evidence_span: According to kinetic models, this reorientation is characterized by two threshold stresses oriented with respect to the orientation of hydrides platelets under a stress free state. The lower threshold stress is related to the minimal tensile stress perpendicular to the normal of the hydrides in their natural orientation leading to the first appearance of reoriented hydrides. The upper threshold stress corresponds to the minimal stress necessary to reorient all possible hydrides.
